content: Hello all, I'm Inior, a newcomer to this space, and I'm eager to delve deeper into the world of crypto. I'm confident that this forum offers valuable resources. Currently, I'm on the lookout for materials to broaden my knowledge of Bitcoin and the overall crypto landscape.

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: Inior on December 10, 2023, 12:26:22 PMHello guys, i am inior and I am new to this forum, with the zeal I have in learning crypto, I believe I can find good resources here. I need materials to further my knowledge about Bitcoin or crypto space generally. Plasey I need your helpWelcome to this forum, I hope you will find what you are looking for here. Actually, you will find some useful material to enhance your knowledge about BTC or other alts. This forum is full of useful information and tutorials and the amazing thing is you can find useful tutorials in your own local language. If you want to know something then be more specific like How Blockchain works, or How to store your BTC for a longer period of time.  You should visit the BTC section which lies on top of the home page, and if you want to learn technical things then do visit the technical discussion section, even if you don't know anything at all and are totally new to the crypto sphere even then you can visit these sections and can make posts there. Because by making posts, you will learn more.Try to remain as active as you can and follow old users because they are the ones who have contributed more to this forum. I would suggest you an encyclopedia of useful topics made on BTT but unfortunately that topic is no more so, I don't have any single useful link for you to give unless you have specific topic to know more about.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: Welcome to the forum. OP, you have been suggested some content that will help you understand the purpose of Bitcoin and the forum.Yeah, the forum has different boards, ranging from Bitcoin technical, Bitcoin discussion, Bitcoin development, Bitcoin mining, etc. You just need to be active on the forum, and in a little time you will be able to know how to source information on the forum. The forum also has a search button, which allows you to peruse the forum and probably find your results if any such discussions have occurred. If you can't find any results, you can go over to any board that you think is very appropriate for your topic and create a new one.
